descript.abstract: This CD-ROM holds a multimedia database with detailed information on microscopic feather structures of 200 bird species from Europe and the Middle East. Its image library contains a unique reference collection of well over 1800 images of feathers and habitus pictures. An innovative computer-guided identification system assists the user in recognizing the identification characters and in quickly identifying the taxa. The interactive geographic information system supports the use of location in selecting potential hit-species. BRIS was developed by ETI, the University of Amsterdam, and the Tel Aviv University with support from the Royal Netherlands Air Force, the Israel Air Force and the SPNI. In combination with, and in addition to this CD-ROM, it is also possible to contract the European Centre for the Identification of Bird Remains (ECIBR) or the Laboratory for Feather Remains Identification for extended (confidential) identification services.
descript.purpose: The identification of bird remains is of great importance to aviation. Bird collisions are hazardous, costing millions of dollars in damage worldwide. Correct identification of the remains improves the accuracy of bird strike statistics and thus contributes to flight safety. In fields like archeology and criminology, in studies of food consumption and in the enforcement of nature protection laws, identification of bird remains is also essential.
descript.supplinf: This information was obtained from the ETI web site - http://www.eti.uva.nl/Products/CD-catalogue.html. (previous geoform was 'CD-ROM')

cntinfo.cntinst: info@eti.uva.nl - general information about ETI. Phone and fax numbers are for general information. Email adress webmaster@eti.uva.nl may know the most about the online World Biodiversity database.

overview.eaover: Entity - birds; Attributes - microscopic feather structures, images of feathers, habitus pictures

distinfo.distliab: ETI is committed to updating its CD-ROM publications in the above mentioned series, including adapting them to hardware configurations and computer operating systems to come (meaning that they will be replaced by new versions when big changes occur). All users of ETI CD-ROM products and the Linnaeus II software can ask for support at our by a helpdesk [support@eti.uva.nl]. We will do our very best to help you with any questions that may arise.

stdorder.ordering: The Copepods CD-ROM can be ordered at your local bookshop, and the following distributor(s): Springer Customer Service, Haberstrasse 7, 69126 Heidelberg, Germany; fax: +49 (0) 6221/345 229; e-mail: orders@springer.de; UNESCO Publishing, 7, place de Fontenoy, 75352 Paris 07 SP, France. ETI-partners may order directly at ETI as they receive a discount on the retail prices of all CD's. The Linnaeus II software for Biodiversity Documentation can be purchased only at ETI.

distinfo.techpreq: Windows: Windows 3.1x/95/98, 486 CPU, 16 MB RAM, Thousands of colors, 4x speed CD-ROM or higher; Macintosh: System 7.x/8.x, 68040/PowerPC CPU, 16MB RAM, Thousands of colors, 4x speed CD-ROM or higher
